alert.note: Alert for Deltana and Tanana Flats; Eastern Alaska Range; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 21 at 1:54PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Heavy Rain Over The Southeast Interior Through Tonight... The Southeast Interior has already had 0.50 to 1.00 inch of rain southeast of Delta Junction to Eagle, with the heaviest amounts along the Alaska Range. An additional 0.50 inch of rain along the North Slopes of the Alaska Range east of Dot Lake is expected tonight. This will cause sharp rises on rivers and streams in the Fortymile, Charley, Goodpaster and Upper Tanana River basins through Wednesday, with streams and small rivers draining the Alaska Range east of Dot Lake having an elevated risk for flooding. People along creeks and rivers in those basins should be alert to rapidly rising water levels.

area.areaDesc: Deltana and Tanana Flats; Eastern Alaska Range; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country
